page.title: 15MAYDAY IN BRANSCOMBE.
page.content: Mayday is on the first day of May.The school children usually do some Maypole dancing and country dancing. Usually the oldest girl and the oldest boy are Mayday queen and king.Before the celebrations start the king and queen have a tour of Branscombe in a vintage car.The king and queen are crowned by a Branscombe personality, sometimes someone to do with the school.The school children have a procession down the lane to the village hall,the older ones carrying decorated hoops.They then bow to the King and Queen and take their seats. Then the dancing begins around the maypole each child holding a ribbon. If the weather permits it is held out of doors,otherwise it is held in the hall. Cream teas follow.An evening country dance finishes the day.
